=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: A Bird of the Air
Review Date: 2018/09/19
Store: Margaret Whitton  (Director, Producer),     Rachel Nichols  (Actor),     Jackson Hurst  (Actor)    &                   0                  more   Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Romance
Product Description: ["A stray parrot brings together Rachel Nichols and Jackson Hurst in an adaptation of Joe Coomer's romantic novel The Loop, directed by Margaret Whitton. Lyman (Hurst) is a quiet loner who works the overnight shift for the Highway Courtesy Patrol. When a talking parrot flies in to his trailer he becomes obsessed with tracking down its previous owners, which leads him to Fiona (Nichols), a librarian who speaks her mind. Together, the pair set off to unravel the past as Fiona opens up Lyman's heart."]
Average Rating: 4.3

Review Text: I loved this movie.  Had all the elements of a really good story,  and great acting. Made me feel really good
Review Title: I felt really good after watching!
Rating: 5.0

Loved the film!!  So well acted and real.
Five Stars
{'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Eva Gardos'], 'Producers': ['Bonnie Timmerman', 'Colleen Camp', 'Bonnie Timmermann'], 'Starring': ['Nastassia Kinski', 'Scarlett Johansson', 'Tony Goldwyn'], 'Studio': ['Paramount Pictures']}
I have seen this several times, and it's still one of my favorite movies of all time. The age we live in is often so full of meaningless things , and love is often put aside. This film captures the heart and much more. It's a story of struggles that anyone can endure, child, teen, adult and senior.....finding meaning and love again.
Amazing film that gives you faith in humanity

profile:
**User Summary:**

The user continues to showcase a profound appreciation for films and shows marked by authentic storytelling that evokes a wide range of genuine emotions. Their recent interactions reveal a preference for lighthearted narratives while maintaining an interest in gripping, dramatic tales centered on themes of love and personal growth. With an impressive average rating of 4.8, the user clearly values high-quality productions and engaging content.

In their latest review, awarded a perfect score, the user highlighted their enjoyment of a romantic film that combined an uplifting narrative with excellent performances, affirming their commitment to emotional engagement in storytelling. This interaction indicates a continued willingness to explore diverse storytelling avenues that inspire and uplift.

The user prefers English content with subtitles for full narrative engagement and appreciates the collaborative nature of filmmaking, recognizing the significant roles of directors and producers. Their reviews reflect an ongoing quest for films that balance sweet, fun narratives with deeper emotional depth, embodying the traits of a thoughtful film critic. 

Overall, the user's profile illustrates a discerning taste for high-quality cinematic experiences that resonate on emotional and personal levels, while remaining open to both lighthearted and impactful stories.
